metadata.Title: CVE-2021-44224 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A crafted URI sent to httpd configured as a forward proxy (ProxyRequests on) can cause a crash (NULL pointer dereference) or, for configurations mixing forward and reverse proxy declarations, can allow for requests to be directed to a declared Unix Domain Socket endpoint (Server Side Request Forgery). This issue affects Apache HTTP Server 2.4.7 up to 2.4.51 (included).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-44224` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

apache2 - 2.4.52-1ubuntu1
apache2-bin - 2.4.52-1ubuntu1
apache2-data - 2.4.52-1ubuntu1
apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.52-1ubuntu1
apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.52-1ubuntu1
apache2-utils - 2.4.52-1ubuntu1
libapache2-mod-md - 2.4.52-1ubuntu1
libapache2-mod-proxy-uwsgi - 2.4.52-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: apache2 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.52-1ubuntu1').
